option.name: fileSummaryMaps
option.value: {"C:/Users/zybko/Desktop/med-predict":"{\"/main.py\":\"This file appears to be a Python script that serves as the entry point for a medical application. It sets up the environment for the application and runs the main application loop.\\n\\n`MedicalApp`: This class likely represents the main application that handles the medical-related functionality.\\n\\n`main()`: This function is the entry point of the script, which creates an instance of the `MedicalApp` class and runs the application.\",\"/main_controller.py\":\"This file contains a single class, `MainController`, which is responsible for managing the main application logic and handling user interactions with the UI.\\n\\n`MainController`: Manages the main application logic, including setting up connections between the view and model, initializing the UI, handling model changes, calculating diagnostic results, validating inputs, and exporting results to a PDF.\\n\\n`setup_connections`: Sets up the connections between the view and the controller\\u0027s event handlers.\\n\\n`initialize_ui`: Initializes the UI by setting the model options and selecting the first model.\\n\\n`on_model_changed`: Updates the UI when the selected model is changed, setting the model description, creating input fields, and clearing any previous results.\\n\\n`on_calculate_requested`: Handles the calculation of the diagnostic result, validating the input values, and displaying the result.\\n\\n`_validate_inputs`: Validates the input values, checking for empty fields and non-numeric values.\\n\\n`on_clear_requested`: Handles the export of the last calculated diagnostic result to a PDF file, prompting the user for a doctor\\u0027s name and a save filename.\\n\\n`on_export_requested`: Exports the last calculated diagnostic result to a PDF file.\",\"/styles.py\":\"This file appears to be a CSS stylesheet for a Qt application. It defines the global font settings and styles for various UI elements, such as the main window, header, cards, form fields, buttons, and scrollbars. The stylesheet also includes styles for message boxes. There are no classes or functions defined in this file, as it is a CSS stylesheet.\\n\\nThe main purpose of this file is to provide a consistent and visually appealing user interface for the Qt application by defining the styles and appearance of the various UI elements.\",\"/MedicalApp.py\":\"`resource_path`: This function retrieves the absolute path to a resource, handling the differences between running the application in development mode and as a compiled executable.\\n\\n`setup_import_paths`: This function sets up the import paths for the application, ensuring that the necessary modules can be found during runtime.\\n\\n`MedicalApp`: This class represents the main application, responsible for setting up the user interface, loading fonts, and running the application.\\n\\n`_load_fonts`: This function registers the Roboto font in the QFontDatabase, ensuring that it is available for use in the application.\\n\\n`run`: This method runs the application, displaying the main window and entering the event loop.\\n\\nOverall, this file sets up the necessary infrastructure for a PyQt6-based medical application, including handling resource paths, setting up import paths, and configuring the application\\u0027s appearance and behavior.\",\"/diagnostic_result.py\":\"This file defines a single class:\\n\\n`DiagnosticResult`: A dataclass that represents the result of a diagnostic test, including the z-value, p-value, conclusion, risk level, and input values.\\n\\nThis file does not contain any functions. It is a simple data model for representing the results of a diagnostic test.\",\"/medical_model.py\":\"`MedicalModel`: A class for performing mathematical calculations related to medical models.\\n\\n`calculate_probability`: Calculates the probability using the logistic function.\\n\\n`get_diagnosis`: Returns the diagnosis and risk level based on the probability and a given threshold.\",\"/pdf_exporter.py\":\"This file contains a class and several functions for exporting medical diagnostic results to a PDF document.\\n\\n`PDFExporter`: A class that handles the export of medical diagnostic results to a PDF file.\\n\\n`resource_path`: A function that gets the absolute path to a resource file, handling the case where the application is packaged as an executable.\\n\\n`_setup_fonts`: A function that sets up the custom fonts (Roboto) for the PDF document, with a fallback to Helvetica if the custom fonts are not found.\\n\\n`export_results`: A function that exports the medical diagnostic results to a PDF file, including the model name, doctor name, input values, calculated values, and conclusion.\",\"/model_config.py\":\"This file defines two classes and several functions:\\n\\n`ModelConfig`: A class that represents the configuration of a medical model, including its name, formula, parameters, fields, threshold, calculation function, and risk descriptions.\\n\\n`ModelRepository`: A class that provides a static method `get_all_models()` to return a dictionary of all available medical models.\\n\\nThe file defines several medical models, each with its own configuration, and provides a way to access and calculate the z-value for these models based on input data.\",\"/widgets.py\":\"`Card`: A custom QFrame widget with a drop shadow effect.\\n\\n`ModernLineEdit`: A custom QLineEdit widget with dynamic border styles based on focus and error state.\\n\\n`AnimatedButton`: A custom QPushButton widget with a hover and press animation effect.\\n\\n`ResultCard`: A custom Card widget that displays a title and a value.\\n\\n`clear_layout`: A function that clears all widgets from a given layout.\\n\\nThis file defines several custom Qt widgets and a utility function for clearing layouts. These components can be used to build modern and visually appealing user interfaces.\",\"/main_window.py\":\"This file defines a `MainWindow` class that represents the main window of a medical prediction application. The file also includes several helper functions and widgets used by the `MainWindow` class.\\n\\n`MainWindow`: Represents the main window of the medical prediction application, which allows users to select a model, enter patient data, and view the predicted results.\\n\\n`create_header`: Creates the header section of the main window, which includes the application title.\\n`create_grid_content`: Creates the main content area of the main window, which is organized in a 2x3 grid layout.\\n`create_model_card`: Creates the card widget for selecting the prediction model and displaying its description.\\n`create_doctor_card`: Creates the card widget for entering the doctor\\u0027s name.\\n`create_input_card`: Creates the card widget for displaying the input fields.\\n`create_buttons_widget`: Creates the widget with the \\\"Calculate\\\", \\\"Clear\\\", and \\\"Export\\\" buttons.\\n`create_results_card`: Creates the card widget for displaying the predicted results.\\n`set_model_options`: Sets the available model options in the model selection dropdown.\\n`set_model_description`: Sets the description for the selected prediction model.\\n`create_input_fields`: Creates the input fields based on the selected prediction model.\\n`_on_text_changed`: Handles changes to the input field text (not implemented in this code).\\n`set_field_error`: Sets an error message for a specific input field.\\n`clear_field_errors`: Clears any error messages for the input fields.\\n`clear_input_fields`: Clears the input fields.\\n`get_input_values`: Retrieves the current values of the input fields.\\n`get_doctor_name`: Retrieves the doctor\\u0027s name entered in the UI.\\n`display_result`: Displays the predicted results in the UI.\\n`clear_results`: Clears the displayed results in the UI.\\n`show_message`: Displays a message box with the specified title, text, and level (info, warning, or error).\\n`ask_save_filename`: Prompts the user to enter a filename for saving the predicted results in PDF format.\\n`apply_styles`: Applies the application\\u0027s stylesheet to the main window.\"}"}
